/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Access Board.name: Access Board

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Access Board
File an Accessibility Complaint

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Access Board.description: The Access Board is an independent federal agency devoted to accessibility for people with disabilities. The Board develops and maintains design criteria for the built environment, transit vehicles, telecommunications equipment, and for electronic and information technology.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/AbilityOne Commis.name: AbilityOne Commission

contact.title: Contact the U.S. AbilityOne Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/AbilityOne Commis.description: The AbilityOne Commission creates job opportunities for people who are blind or have other significant disabilities in the manufacture and delivery of products and services to the Federal Government.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Agency for Intern.name: Agency for International Development (USAID)

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Agency for International Development
Staff Directory

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Agency for Intern.description: The U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) is the principal U.S. agency to extend assistance to countries recovering from disaster, trying to escape poverty, and engaging in democratic reforms.

forms.title: U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) Forms

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Agency for Global.name: Agency for Global Media

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Agency for Global Media

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Agency for Global.description: The U.S. Agency for Global Media, formerly known as the Broadcasting Board of Governors, broadcasts news and information about the United States and the world to audiences abroad.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/African Developme.name: African Development Foundation

contact.title: Contact the African Development Foundation

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/African Developme.description: The African Development Foundation provides grants to community groups and small enterprises that benefit under-served and marginalized groups in Africa.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Advisory Council.name: Advisory Council on Historic Preservation

contact.title: Contact the Advisory Council on Historic Preservation

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Advisory Council.description: The Advisory Council on Historic Preservation encourages the preservation of historic properties across the nation.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Administrative Of.name: Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts

contact.title: Contact the Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Administrative Of.description: The Administrative Office of the United States Courts handles the nonjudicial, administrative business of the United States Courts such as maintaining statistics and managing Court budgets.

website.title: Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Administrative Co.name: Administrative Conference of the United States

contact.title: Contact the Administrative Conference of the United States

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Administrative Co.description: The Administrative Conference of the United States is an independent federal agency dedicated to improving federal agency administrative processes and procedures.

website.title: Administrative Conference of the United States

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Armed Forces Reti.name: Armed Forces Retirement Home

contact.title: Contact the Armed Forces Retirement Home

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Armed Forces Reti.description: The Gulfport and Washington campuses of the Armed Forces Retirement Home are retirement centers for veterans of the U.S. military.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Arctic Research C.name: Arctic Research Commission

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Arctic Research Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Arctic Research C.description: The U.S. Arctic Research Commission develops and recommends a national Arctic research policy.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Archives, Nationa.name: Archives, National Archives and Records Administration (NARA)

contact.title: Contact the National Archives and Records Administration

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Archives, Nationa.description: The National Archives and Records Administration preserves U.S. government records, manages the Presidential Libraries system, and publishes laws, regulations, Presidential, and other public documents.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Appalachian Regio.name: Appalachian Regional Commission

contact.title: Contact the Appalachian Regional Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Appalachian Regio.description: The Appalachian Regional Commission works for sustainable community and economic development in Appalachia.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Amtrak (AMTRAK).name: Amtrak (AMTRAK)

contact.title: Contact the National Railroad Passenger Corporation (AMTRAK)

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Amtrak (AMTRAK).description: Amtrak, the National Railroad Passenger Corporation, provides intercity rail passenger service.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/AmeriCorps.name: AmeriCorps

contact.title: Contact AmeriCorps

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/AmeriCorps.description: Formerly known as the Corporation for National and Community Service, AmeriCorps, and AmeriCorps Seniors engage volunteers in serving directly with nonprofit organizations to tackle the nation's most pressing challenges.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/AmeriCorps/AmeriC.name: AmeriCorps Seniors

contact.title: Contact AmeriCorps Seniors
Find a Volunteer Opportunity Near You

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/AmeriCorps/AmeriC.description: AmeriCorps Seniors is a network of volunteer programs for Americans 55 years and older. Volunteers work in their community doing academic tutoring and mentoring, elderly care, disaster relief, and more.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/American Battle M.name: American Battle Monuments Commission

contact.title: Contact the American Battle Monuments Commission
Order Floral Decorations for Grave Sites

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/American Battle M.description: The American Battle Monuments Commission manages 24 overseas military cemeteries, and 25 memorials, monuments, and markers. Nearly all the cemeteries and memorials honor those who served in World War I or World War II.

local_offices.title: Search for Individuals Buried or Memorialized Overseas

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Bureau of Consume.name: Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection

contact.title: Contact the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
Submit a Complaint

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Bureau of Consume.description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau helps consumers by providing educational materials and accepting complaints. It supervises banks, lenders, and large non-bank entities, such as credit reporting agencies and debt collection companies. The Bureau also works to make credit card, mortgage, and other loan disclosures clearer, so consumers can understand their rights and responsibilities.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Barry M. Goldwate.name: Barry M. Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program

contact.title: Contact the Barry M. Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Barry M. Goldwate.description: The Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program awards scholarships to college students who intend to pursue careers in science, mathematics, and engineering.

local_offices.title: Find a Goldwater Scholarship Faculty Representative

website.title: Barry M. Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Program

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Bankruptcy Courts.name: Bankruptcy Courts

contact.title: Contact the Bankruptcy Courts

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Bankruptcy Courts.description: Each of the 94 federal judicial districts  handles bankruptcy matters, and in almost all districts, bankruptcy cases are filed in the bankruptcy court. Bankruptcy laws help people who can no longer pay their creditors get a fresh start by liquidating their assets to pay their debts, or by creating a repayment plan.

local_offices.title: Find Bankruptcy Courts Offices Near You

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Chief Information.name: Chief Information Officers Council
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Chief Information.description: The CIO Council is the principal interagency forum on Federal agency practices for information technology management.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Chief Human Capit.name: Chief Human Capital Officers Council
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Chief Human Capit.description: The Chief Human Capital Officers Council works to modernize human resources systems, improve the quality of human resources information, and advises on legislation affecting human resources operations.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Chief Financial O.name: Chief Financial Officers Council
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Chief Financial O.description: The Chief Financial Officers Council works to improve financial management in the U.S. government.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Chief Acquisition.name: Chief Acquisition Officers Council
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Chief Acquisition.description: The Chief Acquisition Officers Council monitors and improves the federal acquisition system.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Chemical Safety B.name: Chemical Safety Board

contact.title: Contact the Chemical Safety Board

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Chemical Safety B.description: The Chemical Safety Board investigates industrial chemical accidents.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Central Intellige.name: Central Intelligence Agency (CIA)

contact.title: Contact the Central Intelligence Agency

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Central Intellige.description: The Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) collects, evaluates, and disseminates vital information on economic, military, political, scientific, and other developments abroad to safeguard national security.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Coordinating Coun.name: Coordinating Council on Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention

contact.title: Contact the Coordinating Council on Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Coordinating Coun.description: The Coordinating Council on Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention coordinates, studies the effectiveness of, and makes recommendations on juvenile crime prevention activities.

website.title: Coordinating Council on Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Consumer Product.name: Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC)

contact.title: Contact the Consumer Product Safety Commission
Report an Unsafe Product

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Consumer Product.description: The Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) protects the public from unreasonable risks of serious injury or death from thousands of types of consumer products under its jurisdiction, including products that pose a fire, electrical, chemical, or mechanical hazard or can injure children.

website.title: Report incidents, injuries, or safety concerns

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Congress\u2014U.S.name: Congress—U.S. Senate

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Senate

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Congress\u2014U.S.description: The U.S. Senate and the U.S. House of Representatives make up the two chambers of Congress.  The Senate has 100 members, 2 from each state, who are elected to serve for a term of 6 years.

website.title: Officers and Staff of the Senate

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Congress\u2014U.S.name: Congress—U.S. House of Representatives

contact.title: Contact the U.S. House of Representatives
Contact Your Representative

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Congress\u2014U.S.description: The U.S. House of Representatives and the U.S. Senate make up the two chambers of Congress. The House has 435 members, the number representing each state is determined by population.

website.title: Officers and Organizations of the House

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Commodity Futures.name: Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC)

contact.title: Contact the Commodity Futures Trading Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Commodity Futures.description: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission protects the public from fraud, manipulation, and abusive practices related to the sale of commodity and financial futures and options, and to fosters open, competitive, and financially sound futures and option markets. They investigate and prosecute commodities fraud, including foreign currency schemes, energy manipulation and hedge fund fraud, and works with other federal and state agencies to bring criminal and other actions.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Commission on Sec.name: Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe (Helsinki Commission)

contact.title: Contact the Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe (Helsinki Commission)

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Commission on Sec.description: The Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe monitors and encourages compliance with the Helsinki Final Act and other Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe commitments.

website.title: Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe (Helsinki Commission)

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Commission on Int.name: Commission on International Religious Freedom

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Commission on International Religious Freedom

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Commission on Int.description: The U.S. Commission on International Religious Freedom reviews the facts and circumstances of violations of religious freedom internationally and to make policy recommendations to the President, the Secretary of State and Congress.

website.title: U.S. Commission on International Religious Freedom

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Commission on Civ.name: Commission on Civil Rights

contact.title: Contact the Commission on Civil Rights

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Commission on Civ.description: The U.S. Commission on Civil Rights is an independent, bipartisan agency charged with monitoring federal civil rights enforcement.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Commission of Fin.name: Commission of Fine Arts

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Commission of Fine Arts

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Commission of Fin.description: The U. S. Commission of Fine Arts advises the government on matters pertaining to the arts, and to guide the architectural development of Washington.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Citizens' Stamp A.name: Citizens' Stamp Advisory Committee
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Citizens' Stamp A.description: The Citizens' Stamp Advisory Committee evaluates all stamp proposals. The Committee's primary goal is to select subjects of broad national interest for recommendation to the Postmaster General that are both interesting and educational.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Circuit Courts of.name: Circuit Courts of Appeal

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Courts of Appeal

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Circuit Courts of.description: The U.S. Courts of Appeal hear appeals from lower courts of both civil and criminal trials, but do not investigate the facts of a case. Rather, the Appeals Courts investigate whether or not the law has been fairly and correctly applied by the lower courts.

forms.title: U.S. Circuit Courts of Appeal Forms

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Court Services an.name: Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency for the District of Columbia

contact.title: Contact the Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency for the District of Columbia

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Court Services an.description: The Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency provides supervision of adults on parole, probation, and supervised release in the District of Columbia.

forms.title: Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency for the District of Columbia

website.title: Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency for the District of Columbia

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Court Services an.name: Pretrial Services Agency for the District of Columbia

contact.title: Contact the Pretrial Services Agency for the District of Columbia

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Court Services an.description: The Pretrial Services Agency for the District of Columbia's promotes pretrial justice and enhances community safety.

website.title: Pretrial Services Agency for the District of Columbia

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Court of Internat.name: Court of International Trade

contact.title: Contact the Court of International Trade

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Court of Internat.description: The United States Court of International Trade resolves trade disputes by interpreting and applying customs and international trade laws.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Court of Federal.name: Court of Federal Claims

contact.title: Contact the Court of Federal Claims

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Court of Federal.description: The U.S. Court of Federal Claims has jurisdiction over claims seeking money judgments against the United States.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Court of Appeals.name: Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Court of Appeals.description: The Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims hears appeals of decisions made by the Board of Veterans Appeals. You must have a decision from the Board of Veterans Appeals to bring a case before this court.

forms.title: Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims Forms

website.title: U.S. Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Court of Appeals.name: Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces

contact.title: Contact the Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Court of Appeals.description: The Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces is an appeals court with worldwide jurisdiction for anyone subject to the Uniform Code of Military Justice.

website.title: Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Council of the In.name: Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency

contact.title: Inspectors General Directory
Report Government Waste, Fraud and Abuse

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Council of the In.description: The Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency address integrity, economy, and effectiveness issues in the federal government.

website.title: Council of the Inspectors General on Integrity and Efficiency

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Defense Nuclear F.name: Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board

contact.title: Contact the Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Defense Nuclear F.description: The Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board reviews the content and implementation of health and safety standards at Department of Energy Defense Nuclear Facilities. The board also makes recommendations to the President and Secretary of Energy regarding health and safety issues at Defense Nuclear Facilities.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Director of Natio.name: Director of National Intelligence, Office of

contact.title: Contact the Office of the Director of National Intelligence

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Director of Natio.description: The Office of the Director of National Intelligence integrates the intelligence gathering and analysis functions performed across the intelligence community to provide intelligence to decision makers.
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Director of Natio.main_address: Office of the Director of National Intelligence

website.title: Office of the Director of National Intelligence

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Denali Commission.name: Denali Commission

contact.title: Contact the Denali Commission
Staff Directory

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Denali Commission.description: The Denali Commission provides critical utilities, infrastructure, and economic support throughout Alaska.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Delta Regional Au.name: Delta Regional Authority

contact.title: Contact the Delta Regional Authority

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Delta Regional Au.description: The Delta Regional Authority is a partnership to improve economic and community growth in eight states. Those states are Alabama, Arkansas, Illinois, Kentucky, Louisiana, Mississippi, Missouri, and Tennessee.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Delaware River Ba.name: Delaware River Basin Commission

contact.title: Contact the Delaware River Basin Commission
Staff Directory

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Delaware River Ba.description: In 1961, the federal government and the governments of Delaware, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and New York, entered into an agreement that created the Delaware River Basin Commission. The Commission has the independent legal authority to oversee and manage the Delaware River Basin.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Equal Employment.name: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC)

contact.title: Contact the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Equal Employment.description: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) enforces laws that make discrimination illegal in the workplace. The commission oversees all types of work situations including hiring, firing, promotions, harassment, training, wages, and benefits.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Environmental Pro.name: Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)

contact.title: Contact the Environmental Protection Agency

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Environmental Pro.description: The Environmental Protection Agency protects people and the environment from significant health risks, sponsors and conducts research, and develops and enforces environmental regulations.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Election Assistan.name: Election Assistance Commission (EAC)

contact.title: Contact the Election Assistance Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Election Assistan.description: The Election Assistance Commission (EAC) supports state and local election officials in their efforts to ensure accessible, accurate. and secure elections. EAC develops guidance to meet the Help America Vote Act requirements, adopts voluntary voting system guidelines, and serves as a national clearinghouse of information on election administration. EAC also accredits testing laboratories and certifies voting systems, as well as audits the use of Help America Vote Act funds.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Economic Growth,.name: Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment

contact.title: Contact Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Economic Growth,.description: The Under Secretary of State for Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment leads the State Department’s efforts to develop and implement international policies related to economic growth, energy, agriculture, the ocean, the environment, and science and technology.

website.title: Economic Growth, Energy, and the Environment

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Export-Import Ban.name: Export-Import Bank of the United States

contact.title: Contact the Export-Import Bank of the United States

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Export-Import Ban.description: The Export-Import Bank assists American businesses export their goods by providing financial assistance in the form of loans, loan guarantees and insurance. The focus of the Export-Import Bank is on assisting small businesses.

website.title: Export-Import Bank of the United States

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Election.name: Federal Election Commission

contact.title: Contact the Federal Election Commission
Contact the Public Records Branch

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Election.description: The Federal Election Commission enforces federal campaign finance laws, including monitoring donation prohibitions, and limits and oversees public funding for presidential campaigns.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Deposit I.name: Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC)

contact.title: Contact the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Deposit I.description: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) answers questions about federal deposit insurance coverage, and handles complaints and inquiries about FDIC-insured state banks which are not members of the Federal Reserve System.
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Deposit I.main_address: Division of Depositor and Consumer Protection

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Communica.name: Federal Communications Commission (FCC)

contact.title: Contact the Federal Communications Commission
File a Complaint with the Federal Communications Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Communica.description: The Federal Communications Commission regulates interstate and international communications through cable, radio, television, satellite and wire. The goal of the Commission is to promote connectivity and ensure a robust and competitive market.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Accountin.name: Federal Accounting Standards Advisory Board

contact.title: Contact the Federal Accounting Standards Advisory Board
Staff Directory

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Accountin.description: The Federal Accounting Standards Advisory Board works to improve government accountability by issuing federal financial accounting and reporting standards that conform to industry best practices.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Farm Credit Syste.name: Farm Credit System Insurance Corporation

contact.title: Contact the Farm Credit System Insurance Corporation

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Farm Credit Syste.description: The Farm Credit System Insurance Corporation ensures the payment of principal and interest on insured notes, bonds, and other obligations issued on behalf of Farm Credit System.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Farm Credit Admin.name: Farm Credit Administration

contact.title: Contact the Farm Credit Administration

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Farm Credit Admin.description: The Farm Credit Administration is an independent financial regulatory agency that oversees the Farm Credit System, a nationwide network of lending institutions that serve farmers, ranchers, agricultural cooperatives, and other eligible borrowers. It also oversees the Federal Agricultural Mortgage Corporation or Farmer Mac, which provides a secondary market for agricultural real estate mortgage loans, rural housing loans, and rural cooperative loans.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Trade Com.name: Federal Trade Commission (FTC)

contact.title: Contact the Federal Trade Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Trade Com.description: The Federal Trade Commission works to prevent fraudulent, deceptive, and unfair business practices. They also provide information to help consumers spot, stop, and avoid scams and fraud.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Retiremen.name: Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board

contact.title: Contact the Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Retiremen.description: The Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board administers the Thrift Savings Plan, a tax-deferred retirement account similar to a 401(k).

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Reserve S.name: Federal Reserve System

contact.title: Contact the Federal Reserve System
File a Complaint About a Bank
Comment on Federal Reserve Proposals

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Reserve S.description: The Federal Reserve is the central bank of the United States. It formulates and administers credit and monetary policy.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Mine Safe.name: Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission

contact.title: Contact the Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Mine Safe.description: The Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission is an independent agency that administers trials and hears appeals of disputes relating directly to the Mine Safety and Health Act of 1977.

website.title: Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Mediation.name: Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service

contact.title: Contact the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service
Field Offices

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Mediation.description: The Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service provides mediation and other conflict resolution services for managing and enhancing labor-management relationships.

forms.title: Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service Forms

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Maritime.name: Federal Maritime Commission

contact.title: Contact the Federal Maritime Commission
Bureaus and Offices

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Maritime.description: The Federal Maritime Commission is responsible for regulating the U.S. international ocean transportation system for the benefit of U.S. exporters, importers, and the U.S. consumer.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Library a.name: Federal Library and Information Center Committee

contact.title: Contact the Federal Library and Information Center Committee

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Library a.description: The Federal Library and Information Center Committee coordinates and shares available resources to provide continuing education and training to federal library and information center employees.

website.title: Federal Library and Information Center Committee

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Laborator.name: Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer

contact.title: Contact the Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Laborator.description: The Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer facilitates knowledge and technology sharing across federal laboratories, and speeds the adoption of new knowledge and technologies in the wider economy by facilitating the sharing federal research with non-governmental public and private entities.

website.title: Federal Laboratory Consortium for Technology Transfer

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Labor Rel.name: Federal Labor Relations Authority (FLRA)

contact.title: Contact the Federal Labor Relations Authority

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Labor Rel.description: The Federal Labor Relations Authority is a quasi-judicial body that manages relations between federal agencies and employees.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Judicial.name: Federal Judicial Center
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Judicial.description: The Federal Judicial Center conducts policy research and provides continuing education resources for the judicial branch.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Interagen.name: Federal Interagency Council on Statistical Policy

contact.title: Contact the Federal Interagency Council on Statistical Policy (FedStats)

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Interagen.description: FedStats is a community of practice for over 100 agencies that produce and distribute official federal statistics.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Housing F.name: Federal Housing Finance Agency

contact.title: Contact the Federal Housing Finance Agency

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Housing F.description: The Federal Housing Finance Agency provides supervision, regulation, and housing mission oversight of Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac, and the Federal Home Loan Banks.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Housing F.name: Fannie Mae

contact.title: Contact the Federal National Mortgage Association (Fannie Mae) Contact Fannie Mae

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Housing F.description: Fannie Mae purchases mortgages from lending institutions in an effort to increase affordable lending activity at those institutions. Fannie Mae is not a federal agency. It is a government-sponsored enterprise under the conservatorship of the Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA).

local_offices.title: Find A Local Fannie Mae Mortgage Help Center

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Housing F.name: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation  (Freddie Mac)

contact.title: Contact the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (Freddie Mac)

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Housing F.description: A private corporation founded by Congress, the Federal Home Loan Mortgage corporation's mission is to promote stability and affordability in the housing market by purchasing mortgages from banks and other loan makers. The corporation is currently under conservatorship, under the direction of the Federal Housing Finance Agency.

forms.title: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation  (Freddie Mac) Forms

website.title: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation (Freddie Mac)

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Geographi.name: Federal Geographic Data Committee

contact.title: Contact the Federal Geographic Data Committee

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Geographi.description: The Federal Geographic Data Committee is an interagency group that promotes and coordinates the production, use, and publication of geospatial data.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Financial.name: Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council

contact.title: Contact the Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Federal Financial.description: The Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council is an interagency body that seeks to standardize the oversight criteria and methods of the various financial regulatory bodies.

forms.title: Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Forms

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Government Ethics.name: Government Ethics, Office of (OGE)

contact.title: Contact the Office of Government Ethics
Report Misconduct

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Government Ethics.description: The Office of Government Ethics provides oversight, policy, and guidance to the Executive Branch regarding ethics laws and policies.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/General Services.name: General Services Administration (GSA)

contact.title: Contact the General Services Administration (GSA)
Staff Directory

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/General Services.description: The General Services Administration manages federal property and provides contracting options for government agencies.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Holocaust Memoria.name: Holocaust Memorial Museum

contact.title: Contact the Holocaust Memorial Museum

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Holocaust Memoria.description: A living memorial to the victims of the Holocaust, the Memorial Museum was built on donated federal land and is funded through private donations.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Harry S. Truman S.name: Harry S. Truman Scholarship Foundation

contact.title: Contact the Harry S. Truman Scholarship Foundation

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Harry S. Truman S.description: The Harry S. Truman Scholarship Foundation provides scholarships to college juniors who demonstrate outstanding potential, and who plan to pursue a career in public service.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Interagency Counc.name: Interagency Council on Homelessness

contact.title: Contact the Interagency Council on Homelessness
Find Help for Homeless People

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Interagency Counc.description: The Interagency Council on Homelessness works in partnership with every level of government and the private sector to reduce and end homelessness in the nation.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Interagency Commi.name: Interagency Committee for the Management of Noxious and Exotic Weeds
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Interagency Commi.description: With representatives from 16 federal agencies, this committee partners with the public and private organizations to identify and manage invasive plants in the U.S.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Interagency Alter.name: Interagency Alternative Dispute Resolution Working Group

contact.title: Federal Alternative Dispute Resolution Programs and Contacts

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Interagency Alter.description: The Interagency Alternative Dispute Resolution Working Group helps federal agencies develop and implement Alternative Dispute Resolution programs.

website.title: Interagency Alternative Dispute Resolution Working Group

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Inter-American Fo.name: Inter-American Foundation

contact.title: Contact the Inter-American Foundation

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Inter-American Fo.description: The Inter-American Foundation provides grant support to Latin American and Caribbean grass-roots groups and non-governmental organizations with creative self-help ideas.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Institute of Peac.name: Institute of Peace

contact.title: Contact the Institute of Peace

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Institute of Peac.description: The Institute of Peace promotes research, policy analysis, education, and training on international peace and conflict resolution in an effort to prevent and resolve violent conflicts, and to promote post-conflict stability.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Institute of Muse.name: Institute of Museum and Library Services

contact.title: Contact the Institute of Museum and Library Services

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Institute of Muse.description: The Institute of Museum and Library Services is a grant making organization that also conducts research and develops policy. The Institute helps libraries and museums innovate, fosters lifelong learning and cultural and civic engagement.

forms.title: Institute of Museum and Library Services Forms

website.title: Institute of Museum and Library Services

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/International Tra.name: International Trade Commission

contact.title: Contact the U.S. International Trade Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/International Tra.description: The International Trade Commission investigates whether or not, and to what extent, an unfair trade practice harms U.S. businesses. When unfair trade practices are found to harm U.S. businesses, the Commission may implement corrective measures. The Commission also provides the President and Congress impartial information on international trade to inform trade policy.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/International Dev.name: International Development Finance Corporation (DFC)

contact.title: Contact the International Development Finance Corporation (DFC)

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/International Dev.description: The U.S. International Development Finance Corporation (DFC) is America’s development bank. DFC partners with the private sector to finance solutions to the most critical challenges facing the developing world.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Judicial Panel on.name: Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation

contact.title: Contact the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Judicial Panel on.description: The Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation determines whether civil actions pending in two or more federal judicial districts should be transferred to a single federal district court for pretrial proceedings.

forms.title: Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation Forms

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Joint Fire Scienc.name: Joint Fire Science Program

contact.title: Contact the Joint Fire Science Program

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Joint Fire Scienc.description: The Joint Fire Science Program provides fire science information, resources and funding announcements for scientists, fire practitioners, and decision makers.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Joint Congression.name: Joint Congressional Committee on Inaugural Ceremonies
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Joint Congression.description: Made up of members of the House and Senate, the Joint Congressional Committee on Inaugural Ceremonies is responsible for planning and carrying out the President's swearing-in ceremony at the U.S. Capitol.

website.title: Joint Congressional Committee on Inaugural Ceremonies

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Joint Board for t.name: Joint Board for the Enrollment of Actuaries

contact.title: Contact the Joint Board for the Enrollment of Actuaries

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Joint Board for t.description: The Joint Board for the Enrollment of Actuaries specifies the standards and qualifications an individual must meet in order to perform actuarial services.

website.title: Joint Board for the Enrollment of Actuaries

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/John F. Kennedy C.name: John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts

contact.title: Contact the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/John F. Kennedy C.description: The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts is a living memorial to President John F. Kennedy. The Center offers a wide range of performances, including frequent free or low-cost performances. The Center also runs a number of educational and outreach programs.

website.title: John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts
Today's Free Live Stream from the Kennedy Center

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Japan-United Stat.name: Japan-United States Friendship Commission

contact.title: Contact the Japan-United States Friendship Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Japan-United Stat.description: The Japan-United States Friendship Commission gives grants to stimulate engagement in business, educational, or cultural exchanges with Japan.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/James Madison Mem.name: James Madison Memorial Fellowship Foundation
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/James Madison Mem.description: The James Madison Memorial Fellowship Foundation offers fellowship opportunities to individuals who are seeking a Master's degree in order to teach secondary students about the U.S. Constitution.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Library of Congre.name: Library of Congress (LOC)

contact.title: Contact the Library of Congress
Copyright Questions
Report Catalog and Authority Record Errors

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Library of Congre.description: The Library of Congress provides Congress with objective research to inform the legislative process, administers the national copyright system, and manages the largest collection of books, recordings, photographs, maps and manuscripts in the world.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Legal Services Co.name: Legal Services Corporation

contact.title: Contact the Legal Services Corporation

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Legal Services Co.description: The Legal Services Corporation is an independent corporation founded by Congress that provides grant funds, training, and technical assistance to civil legal aid programs. The Corporation ensures low income individuals and families have access to quality legal aid.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Medicaid and CHIP.name: Medicaid and CHIP Payment and Access Commission
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Medicaid and CHIP.description: The Medicaid and CHIP Payment and Access Commission reviews federal and state medicaid and CHIP policies and makes recommendations to Congress, the department of health and human services, and the states.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Meat and Poultry.name: Meat and Poultry Hotline
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Meat and Poultry.description: This hotline answers questions about the safe storage, handling, and preparation of meat, poultry, and egg products to help you prevent foodborne illness.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Marine Mammal Com.name: Marine Mammal Commission

contact.title: Contact the Marine Mammal Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Marine Mammal Com.description: The Marine Mammal Commission provides oversight of all marine mammal conservation policies and programs carried out by federal regulatory agencies.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Morris K. Udall a.name: Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation

contact.title: Contact the Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Morris K. Udall a.description: The Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation provides assessment, mediation, and other services to resolve environmental conflicts. The Foundation also supports educational opportunities in the area of environmental policy.

website.title: Morris K. Udall and Stewart L. Udall Foundation

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Mississippi River.name: Mississippi River Commission

contact.title: Contact the Mississippi River Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Mississippi River.description: The Mississippi River Commission researches and provides policy and work recommendations in the areas of flood control, navigation, and environmental projects.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Millennium Challe.name: Millennium Challenge Corporation

contact.title: Contact the Millennium Challenge Corporation

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Millennium Challe.description: The Millennium Challenge Corporation partners with the best-governed poor countries worldwide to promote economic growth and help people lift themselves out of poverty.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Merit Systems Pro.name: Merit Systems Protection Board

contact.title: Contact the Merit Systems Protection Board

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Merit Systems Pro.description: The Merit Systems Protection Board hears appeals from federal employees, and studies federal merit systems in an effort to protect the rights of federal employees.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Medicare Payment.name: Medicare Payment Advisory Commission

contact.title: Contact the Medicare Payment Advisory Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Medicare Payment.description: The Medicare Payment Advisory Commission advises Congress on a range of issues affecting Medicare, including payments, services, access, and regulations.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Aeronaut.name: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

contact.title: Contact the National Aeronautics and Space Administration

forms.title: National Aeronautics and Space Administration Forms

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Indian G.name: National Indian Gaming Commission

contact.title: Contact the National Indian Gaming Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Indian G.description: The National Indian Gaming Commission is a regulatory body that oversees some aspects of gaming on Indian lands, often complementing the work of Indian regulators.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Gallery.name: National Gallery of Art

contact.title: Contact the National Gallery of Art

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Gallery.description: The National Gallery of Art collects, preserves and exhibits art works, and works to promote the understanding of art through research and educational programs.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Endowmen.name: National Endowment for the Humanities

contact.title: Contact the National Endowment for the Humanities
Staff Directory

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Endowmen.description: The National Endowment for the Humanities funds humanities programs in the United States such as museums, archives, libraries, colleges, universities, public television, radio stations, and individual scholars.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Endowmen.name: National Endowment for the Arts (NEA)

contact.title: Contact the National Endowment for the Arts
Staff Directory

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Endowmen.description: The National Endowment for the Arts funds, promotes, and strengthens the creative capacity of our communities by providing all Americans with opportunities for arts participation.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Credit U.name: National Credit Union Administration (NCUA)

contact.title: Contact the National Credit Union Administration

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Credit U.description: The National Credit Union Administration charters and supervises federal credit unions, and insures savings in federal and most state-chartered credit unions.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Council.name: National Council on Disability

contact.title: Contact the National Council on Disability

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Council.description: The National Council on Disability makes recommendations to the President and Congress on policies affecting Americans with disabilities. They empower individuals with disabilities, and promote equal opportunity.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Constitu.name: National Constitution Center

contact.title: Contact the National Constitution Center

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Constitu.description: The National Constitution Center is a state-of-the-art museum dedicated to the study of the U.S. Constitution. The museum is also a national hub for constitutional education and outreach.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Capital.name: National Capital Planning Commission

contact.title: Contact the National Capital Planning Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Capital.description: The National Capital Planning Commission crafts long-range plans and policies for the National Capital Region. The Commission provides building and zoning advice to Washington, DC and the surrounding area, and approves various federal construction plans.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Science.name: National Science Foundation (NSF)

contact.title: Contact the National Science Foundation
Staff Directory

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Science.description: The National Science Foundation supports research and education across all fields of science and technology, primarily through grants.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Park Fou.name: National Park Foundation

contact.title: Contact the National Park Foundation

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Park Fou.description: The National Park Foundation supports America’s national parks through conservation, preservation, education, and community engagement.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Mediatio.name: National Mediation Board

contact.title: Contact the National Mediation Board

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Mediatio.description: The National Mediation Board facilitates the resolution of labor-management disputes in the rail and airline industries.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Labor Re.name: National Labor Relations Board (NLRB)

contact.title: Contact the National Labor Relations Board

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Labor Re.description: The National Labor Relations Board enforces the National Labor Relations Act by investigating allegations of wrong-doing brought by workers, unions, or employers, conducting elections, and deciding and resolving cases.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Interage.name: National Interagency Fire Center

contact.title: Contact the National Interagency Fire Center
Staff Directory

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Interage.description: The National Interagency Fire Center coordinates the national mobilization of resources for wildland fire and other incidents throughout the United States.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Nuclear Waste Tec.name: Nuclear Waste Technical Review Board
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Nuclear Waste Tec.description: The Nuclear Waste Technical Review Board provides scientific and technical oversight of the Department of Energy's program for managing and disposing of high-level nuclear waste and spent nuclear fuel.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Nuclear Regulator.name: Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC)

contact.title: Contact the Nuclear Regulatory Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Nuclear Regulator.description: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission regulates commercial nuclear power plants, and other uses of nuclear materials.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Northwest Power a.name: Northwest Power and Conservation Council

contact.title: Contact the Northwest Power and Conservation Council

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Northwest Power a.description: The Northwest Power and Conservation Council develops energy plans for the pacific northwest that include conservation efforts for local fish and wildlife.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Northern Border R.name: Northern Border Regional Commission
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Northern Border R.description: The Northern Border Regional Commission is a federal-state partnership for economic, and community development in northern Maine, New Hampshire, Vermont, and New York.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Transpor.name: National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB)

contact.title: Contact the National Transportation Safety Board

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/National Transpor.description: The National Transportation Safety Board investigates every civil aviation accident in the U.S. and significant accidents in other modes of transportation. Based on their investigative findings and special studies, the board makes recommendations aimed at preventing future accidents.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Occupational Safe.name: Occupational Safety and Health Review Commission

contact.title: Contact the Occupational Safety and Health Review Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Occupational Safe.description: The Occupational Safety and Health Review Commission hears trials and appeals, deciding contests of citations or penalties that result from inspections performed by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration.

website.title: Occupational Safety and Health Review Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Office of Special.name: Office of Special Counsel

contact.title: Contact the Office of Special Counsel

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Office of Special.description: The Office of Special Counsel is an investigative and prosecutorial office that works to end government and political corruption, and to protect government employees and whistleblowers.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Office of Personn.name: Office of Personnel Management (OPM)

contact.title: Contact the Office of Personnel Management

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Office of Personn.description: The Office of Personnel Management manages the civil service of the federal government, coordinates recruiting of new government employees, and manages their health insurance and retirement benefits programs. They  also provide resources for locating student jobs, summer jobs, scholarships, and internships.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Presidio Trust.name: Presidio Trust
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Presidio Trust.description: The Presidio Trust preserves the Presidio National Park as an enduring resource for the American people.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Postal Service (U.name: Postal Service (USPS)

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Postal Service

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Postal Service (U.main_address: USPS Office of the Consumer Advocate

contact.title: Contact the Postal Regulatory Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Postal Regulatory.description: The Postal Regulatory Commission is responsible for oversight of the U.S. Postal Service, including oversight of rates and services, and ensuring the Postal Service meets all of its legal requirements.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Pension Benefit G.name: Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation (PBGC)

contact.title: Contact the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Pension Benefit G.description: The Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation insures and guarantees private sector workers' pensions.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Peace Corps.name: Peace Corps

contact.title: Contact the Peace Corps

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Peace Corps.description: Peace Corps volunteers travel to developing countries all over the world to assist with many ongoing efforts including AIDS education, business training, and information infrastructure development.

local_offices.title: Find a Recruitment Office Near You

contact.title: Contact the Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Privacy and Civil.description: The Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board ensures that the federal government’s efforts to prevent terrorism are balanced with the need to protect privacy and civil liberties.​

website.title: Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Railroad Retireme.name: Railroad Retirement Board (RRB)

contact.title: Contact the Railroad Retirement Board

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Railroad Retireme.description: The Railroad Retirement Board administers retirement, survivor, unemployment, and sickness benefits for U.S. railroad workers and their families.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Social Security A.name: Social Security Advisory Board

contact.title: Contact the Social Security Advisory Board

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Social Security A.description: The Social Security Advisory Board advises the president, congress and the commissioner of Social Security on Social Security and Supplemental Security Income policy.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Social Security A.name: Social Security Administration (SSA)

contact.title: Contact the Social Security Administration

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Social Security A.description: The Social Security Administration assigns Social Security numbers, and administers the Social Security retirement, survivors, and disability insurance programs. They also administer the Supplemental Security Income program for the aged, blind, and disabled.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Smithsonian Insti.name: Smithsonian Institution

contact.title: Contact the Smithsonian Institution

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Small Business Ad.name: Small Business Administration (SBA)

contact.title: Contact the Small Business Administration

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Small Business Ad.description: The Small Business Administration helps Americans start, build and grow businesses. Through an extensive network of field offices and partnerships, the Small Business Administration assists and protects the interests of small business concerns.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Sentencing Commis.name: Sentencing Commission

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Sentencing Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Sentencing Commis.description: The U.S. Sentencing Commission studies and develops sentencing policies for the federal courts. The Commission serves as an information resource for Congress, the executive, the courts and the public on matters relating to federal crime and sentencing as well.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Selective Service.name: Selective Service System (SSS)

contact.title: Contact the Selective Service System

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Selective Service.description: The Selective Service System provides the Department of Defense personnel in the event of a national emergency. Male citizens and immigrants are required to register with the Selective Service when they turn 18.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Securities and Ex.name: Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)

contact.title: Contact the Securities and Exchange Commission
File an Investor Complaint

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Securities and Ex.description: The Securities and Exchange Commission oversees securities exchanges, securities brokers and dealers, investment advisors, and mutual funds in an effort to promote fair dealing, the disclosure of important market information, and to prevent fraud.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Susquehanna River.name: Susquehanna River Basin Commission

contact.title: Contact the Susquehanna River Basin Commission

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Susquehanna River.description: The Susquehanna River Basin Commission is an interstate body, with representatives from New York, Maryland, Pennsylvania and the federal government, that manages the environmental stewardship and economic development of the Susquehanna river and its tributaries.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Surface Transport.name: Surface Transportation Board

contact.title: Contact the Surface Transportation Board

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Surface Transport.description: The Surface Transportation Board regulates and decides disputes involving railroad rates, railroad mergers or line sales, and certain other transportation matters.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Supreme Court of.name: Supreme Court of the United States

contact.title: Contact the Supreme Court of the United States

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Supreme Court of.description: The U.S. Supreme Court is the final appellate court of the U.S. judicial system. It has the power to review and overturn the decisions of lower courts. The Supreme Court also has original jurisdiction (being the first and final court to hear a case) in certain cases involving public officials, ambassadors, or disputes between states.

website.title: Supreme Court of the United States

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Supreme Court of.name: Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit

contact.title: Contact the Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Supreme Court of.description: With a national jurisdiction, the Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit hears appeals on patent and certain civil cases from courts such as the U.S. Court of International Trade and the Court of Federal Claims, among others. The Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit may also review the administrative rulings of the Patent and Trademark Office, the Secretary of Commerce and other agencies.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/State Justice Ins.name: State Justice Institute
/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/State Justice Ins.description: The State Justice Institute is a grant-making organization dedicated to improving the quality of justice in all state courts. It also works to facilitate better coordination between state and federal courts.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Trade and Develop.name: Trade and Development Agency

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Trade and Development Agency
Staff Directory

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Trade and Develop.description: The United States Trade and Development Agency links U.S. businesses to export opportunities by funding project planning activities, pilot projects, and reverse trade missions.

contact.title: Contact the Tennessee Valley Authority

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Tennessee Valley.description: The Tennessee Valley Authority provides low-cost electricity in seven southeastern states, and provides flood control, navigation, and land management for the Tennessee River system.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Tax Court.name: Tax Court

contact.title: Contact the Tax Court

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/Tax Court.description: The Tax Court decides disputes between the Internal Revenue Service and taxpayers.

contact.title: Contact the White House

contact.title: Contact the U.S. Department of Commerce

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/White House/Counc.name: Council on Environmental Quality

contact.title: Contact the Council on Environmental Quality

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/White House/Counc.description: The Council on Environmental Quality coordinates federal environmental activities, and the development of environmental policy.

contact.title: Contact the Council of Economic Advisers

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/White House/Counc.description: The Council of Economic Advisers gives the president advice on domestic and international economic policy.

contact.title: Contact the Department of Defense (public inquiries)

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/White House/Defen.description: The Department of Defense provides the military forces needed to deter war, and to protect the security of the United States.

contact.title: Contact the Department of Veterans Affairs

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/White House/Depar.description: The Department of Veterans Affairs runs programs benefiting veterans and members of their families. contact.title: Contact the Department of the Interior

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/White House/Depar.name: Department of Energy (DOE)

contact.title: Contact the Department of Energy

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/White House/Depar.description: The Department of Energy manages the United States' nuclear infrastructure and administers the country's energy policy. The Department of Energy also funds scientific research in the field.

contact.title: Contact the Department of Education
Student Loan Questions

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/White House/Depar.description: The Department of Education fosters educational excellence, and to ensures equal access to educational opportunity for all.

contact.title: Contact the National Security Council

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/White House/Natio.description: The National Security Council advises the President on national security and foreign policy.

contact.title: Contact the Office of Science and Technology Policy

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/White House/Offic.description: The Office of Science and Technology Policy advises the president on the effects of science and technology on domestic and international affairs.

contact.title: Contact the Office of Management and Budget

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/White House/Offic.description: The Office of Management and Budget oversees the performance of federal agencies, and administers the federal budget.

/US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/White House/Trade.description: The U.S. Trade Representative negotiates with foreign governments to craft trade agreements and resolve disputes.
